title: Unified Prompt Attack Against Text-to-Image Generation Models
author: Duo Peng (Singapore University of Technology and Design), Qiuhong Ke (Monash University), Mark He Huang (Singapore University of Technology and Design), Ping Hu (University of Electronic Science and Technology of China), Jun Liu (Lancaster University, Singapore University of Technology and Design), ...
relevance_why: The methods proposed in this paper, such as gradient-based optimization and prompt generation, could inform future approaches to audio generation tasks that require similar adversarial techniques for synthesis.
background: Attacking Text-to-Image (T2I) models involves crafting adversarial prompts to generate images that bypass security mechanisms in image generation APIs.
contribution: This paper introduces the Unified Prompt Attack Model (UPAM) to efficiently generate adversarial prompts that can bypass both textual filters and visual checkers in Text-to-Image models, achieving improved success rates in generating harmful content.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often relied on enumeration techniques which were time-consuming and ineffective against dual-defense mechanisms in T2I models.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes gradient-based optimization to enhance both efficiency and effectiveness, enabling successful attack with fewer queries.

key_innovation: Integration of Sphere-Probing Learning and Semantic-Enhancing Learning to effectively discover gradients for prompt crafting without direct image feedback.
real_world_impact: This research highlights vulnerabilities in T2I models, which could prompt enhancements in security for AI image generation systems, ensuring safer deployment in sensitive contexts.
limitations: The methods primarily focus on evading defenses but do not address ethical considerations surrounding the generation of harmful content.

new_terms.Sphere-Probing Learning: **Sphere-Probing Learning** is a technique introduced in this work that estimates gradients by sampling in a parameter space to optimize adversarial prompts.
new_terms.Semantic-Enhancing Learning: **Semantic-Enhancing Learning** refers to a method used to adjust prompts to ensure the generated images align with harmful semantics while avoiding detection by defense mechanisms.
